  text: "To add ten years of projections onto your time series you can use `FIMS::FIMSFrame()` to add -999 to all of your data streams by just adding a single year of -999 for any type with the maximum year that you want to project to. See the code below for an example, which was taken from the [projections vignette](https://noaa-fims.github.io/FIMS/articles/fims-demo-projections.html). Now we need to think carefully about the default uncertainty values for the -999 in each type."

::: {#photo-code}
```
data("data1", package = "FIMS")
years_of_projections <- 10
data1_with_extra_year <- dplyr::add_row(
  data1,
  type = "landings",
  timing = get_end_year(data_4_model) + years_of_projection,
  name = "fleet1",
  value = -999,
  unit = "mt"
) |>
  # Make a FIMSFrame object out of this data frame with the extra row to add all
  # of the other missing years for each data type
  FIMSFrame()
```
:::
